perturbation.original_text: 1.1   In this Agreement, unless the context otherwise requires, the following shall have the meaning as set forth against them below:   "Act" shall mean the Companies Act, 1956, and includes, where the context so requires, any re-enactment or statutory modifications thereof for the time being in force.   "Affiliate(s)" shall mean with respect to any Party to this Agreement any entity which controls, is controlled by, or is under common control with such Party. An entity controls another entity when it owns or controls, directly or indirectly, fifty-one percent (51%) or more of the equity share capital issued and outstanding of the other entity or when it controls, on its own or jointly, the majority of the composition of the Board of Directors of such other entity.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.1   In this Agreement, unless the context otherwise requires, the following shall have the meaning as set forth against them below:   "Act" shall mean the Companies Act, 1956, and includes, where the context so requires, any re-enactment or statutory modifications thereof for the time being in force.   "Affiliate(s)" shall mean with respect to any Party to this Agreement any entity which controls, is controlled by, or is under common control with such Party. An entity controls another entity when it owns or controls, directly or indirectly, twenty-five percent (25%) or more of the equity share capital issued and outstanding of the other entity or when it controls, on its own or jointly, the majority of the composition of the Board of Directors of such other entity.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of "Affiliate(s)" is modified to say that an entity controls another when it owns just 25% (instead of 51%) or more of the share capital. This creates a contradiction because it makes the definition of what constitutes an affiliate ambiguous.

perturbation.original_text:
14.1   IMPCO expressly agrees that during the existence of this Agreement, IMPCO shall not enter into any other Joint Venture Agreement or Marketing/Distribution Agreement, with any company or person(s) in the Territory with respect to the Products.

14.2   MINDA/MIL, since it will have access to the Technical Know-How which it would not have had otherwise, expressly agree that:
perturbation.changed_text:
14.1   IMPCO expressly agrees that during the existence of this Agreement, IMPCO shall not enter into any other Joint Venture Agreement or Marketing/Distribution Agreement, with any company or person(s) in the Territory with respect to the Products.

14.2   IMPCO may enter into another joint venture agreement or marketing/distribution agreement with any company or person(s) in the Territory with respect to the Products, after informing MINDA/MIL in writing.

14.3   MINDA/MIL, since it will have access to the Technical Know-How which it would not have had otherwise, expressly agree that:
perturbation.explanation: Clause 14.2 now directly contradicts 14.1 by allowing IMPCO to enter into other similar agreements as long as MINDA/MIL is informed. This creates uncertainty about the exclusivity of the joint venture.

perturbation.original_text:
16.1   This Agreement shall become effective on the date of execution and shall continue in force and effect for an indefinite term thereafter unless terminated pursuant to the provisions of Article 16 or by all the Parties in writing.

16.2   A party shall be automatically excluded from the provisions of this Agreement if it ceases to be a shareholder in the JVC. In such event, such party shall cause all its Directors and other nominees and representatives to resign from their positions held in the JVC, immediately.
perturbation.changed_text:
16.1   This Agreement shall become effective on the date of execution and shall continue in force and effect for an indefinite term thereafter unless terminated pursuant to the provisions of Article 16 or by all the Parties in writing.

16.2   A party shall be automatically excluded from the provisions of this Agreement if it ceases to be a shareholder in the JVC. In such event, the remaining parties will decide if such party shall cause all its Directors and other nominees and representatives to resign from their positions held in the JVC, immediately.
perturbation.explanation: The original Clause 16.2 mandates immediate resignation of directors and nominees of a party ceasing to be a shareholder. The modified version introduces uncertainty by stating that the remaining parties will decide whether the resignation shall occur. This is contradictory to the word 'automatically' making the resignation no longer an automatic action, creating potential ambiguity.
